intro: Echinopsis riviere-de-caraltii, commonly known as the Caralți's echinopsis, is a species of cactus native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its cylindrical stem and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the cooler months. The plant has a dense covering of spines, which provide protection from herbivores and reduce water loss. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
